gurmukhi: XO ieh auqr dyq BeI qb Xw ibiD so aun bwq krI hY ] rwDy bulwie ilau ros kro nih ikau kir kop ky sMg BrI hY ]
transliteration: Yau Eh Outar Det Bhaitab Yaa Bidh(i) So Oun Baat Karihai Raadhe Bulaae Lio Ros Daro Nah(i) Kio Kar(i) Kop Ke San Bharihai||
translation: When Radha replied like this, the friend said again, “O Radha, you may call Krishna; you are getting enraged in vain;

gurmukhi: qU ieq mwn rhI kir kY auq hyrq pY irpu cMd hrI hY ] qUM n krY prvwh hrI hir kO qumrI prvwh prI hY ]711]
transliteration: Too It Maan Rahikar(i) Kai Out Heart Pai Rip(u) Channd Harihai|| Toon Na Darai Parvaah Harihar(i) Kau Toumriparvaah Parihai||711||
translation: “On this side, you are resisting in ego and on that side even moonshine seems inimical to Krishna, undoubtedly, you do not care for Krishna, but Krishna cares fully for you.”711.

gurmukhi: XyN kih bwq khI iPir XO auT byg clo cilhohu sMjogI ] qwhI ky nYn lgy ieh Taur joaU sB logn ko rs BogI ]
transliteration: Yon Kah(i) Baat Kahiphir(i) You Outh Beg Chalo Chalihoh(u) Sanjogee|| Taahike Nain Lage Eh Thaur Jooo Sabh Logad Ko Ras Bhogee||
translation: Saying this, that friend said again, “O Radha, you go quickly and see Krishna quickly; he, who is the enjoyer of the passionate love of all, his eyes are centred on this abode of yours;

gurmukhi: qw ky n pws clY sjnI aun ko kCu jYhY n Awpn KogI ] qÍY muK rI bl dyKn ko jdurwie ky nYn Bey doaU ibEgI ]712]
transliteration: Taa Ke Na Paas Chalai Sajnioun Ko Kachhu Jai-hai Na Aapan Khogee|| Tvai Moukh Ribal Dekhan Ko Jaduraae Ke Nain Bhae Dooo Biogee||712||
translation: “O friend ! if you do not go to him, he will lose nothing, the loss will be only yours; both the eyes of Krishna are unhappy because of separation from you.712.

gurmukhi: pyKq hY nhI Aaur qRIXw qumro eI suno bil pMiQ inhwrY ] qyry hI DXwn ibKY Atky qumrI hI ikDO bil bwq aucwrY ]
transliteration: Pekhat Hai Nahiaur Treeyaa Toumro Isouno Bal(i) Panth(i) Nihdarai|| Dere Hidhyaan Bikhai Atke Toumrihikidhau Bal(i) Baat Ouchdarai||
translation: “O Radha ! He does not see towards any other woman and is only looking for your coming; he is focusing his attention on you and only talks about you;

gurmukhi: JUm igrY kbhUM DrnI pr qÍY siD Awpn Awp sMBwrY ] qaun smY sKI qoih icqwir kY sXwm jU mYn ko mwn invwrY ]713]
transliteration: Jhoon Girai Kab-hoon Dharnidar Tvai Madh(i) Aapan Aap Sanbhdarai|| Taoun Samai Sakhitohe Chidaar(i) Aapan Aap Sanbhdarai|| Taoun Samai Sakhitohe Chidaar(i) Kai Syaam Joo Main Ko Maan Nivdarai||713||
translation: “Sometimes, he controls himself and sometimes, he swings and falls on the ground; O friend! at the time when he remembers you, it seems that he is shattering the pride of the god of love.”713.

gurmukhi: qw qy n mwn kro sjnI auiT byg clo kCu SMk n Awno ] sXwm kI bwq suno hm qy qumry icq mY Apno icq mwno ]
transliteration: Taa Te Na Maan Daro Sajniouth(i) Beg Chalo Kachhu Shank Na Aano|| Syaam Kibaat Souno Ham Te Toumre Chit Mai Apno Chit Mai Apno Chit Maano||
translation: “Therefore, O friend ! do not be egoistic and forsaking your hesitation go quickly; if you ask from me regarding Krishna, then think that his mind thinks only of your mind;

gurmukhi: qyry hI DXwn Psy hirjU kir kY mn Sok ASok bhwno ] mUV rhI Ablw kir mwn kCU hir ko nhI hyq pCwno ]714]
transliteration: Dere Hidhyaan Phase Har(i)joo Kar(i) Kai Man Shok Ashok Bahaano|| Moond Rahiablaa Kar(i) Maan Kachhodh Hr(i) Ko Nahihet Pachhaado||714||
translation: “He is entrapped in your thoughts under several pretentions; O fooling woman! You are becoming egoistic in vain and are not recognising the interest of Krishna.”714.

gurmukhi: gÍwrin kI sun kY bqIXw qb rwiDkw au`qr dyq BeI ] ikh hyq khXo qij ky hir pws mnwvn mohU ky kwj DeI ]
transliteration: Gvaaran(i) Kisoun Kai Bateeyaa Tab Raadhikaa Outtar Det Bhaikih Het Kahyo Taj(i) Ke Har(i) Paas Manaavan Mohoo Ke Kaaj Dhaee||
translation: Listening to the words of the gopi, Radha replied, “Who had asked you to leave Krishna and come to persuade me?

gurmukhi: nih hau cilhO hir pws khXo qumrI Dau khw giq hÍY hY deI ] sKI Aaurn nwm su mUV DrY n lKY ieh hauhUM ik mUV meI ]715]
transliteration: Nah(i) Hau Chalihau Har(i) Paas Kahyo Toumridhau Kahaa Gad(i) Hvai Hai Daee|| Sakhiauran Naam Su Moond Ddarai Na Lakhai Eh Hauhoon Ki Moond Ddarai Na Lakhai Eh Hauhoon Ki Moond Maee||715||
translation: “I shall not go to Krishna; what to say of you, even if the Providence wants it, I shall not go to him; O friend ! the names of others abide in his mind and is not looking towards a fool like me.”715.

gurmukhi: sun kY biRKBwn suqw ko khXo ieh BwNq so gÍwrn au`qr dIno ] rI sun gÍwrin mo bqIXw iqn hUM sun sROn sunYby kau kIno ]
transliteration: Soun Kai Brikhbhaan Soutaa Ko Kahyo Eh Bhaant So Gvaaran Outtar Deeno|| Risoun Gvaaran(i) Mo Batiyaa Tin Hoon Soun Sraoun Sounaibe Kau Keeno||
translation: Listening to the words of Radha, the gopi replied, “O gopi! listen to my words; he has asked me to say something to you for your attention;

gurmukhi: moih khY suK qy ik qUM mUV mY mUV quhI mn mY kir cIno ] mY jdurwie kI ByjI AeI suin qY jdurwie hUM so hT kIno ]716]
transliteration: Mohe Kahai Moukh Te Ki Toon Moond Tuhiman Mai Kar(i) Cheeno|| Mai Jaduraae Kibhejiaisoun(i) Tai Jaduraae Hoon So Hath Keeno||716||
translation: “You are addressing me as a fool, but think for a while in your mind that, in fact, you are a fool; I have been sent by Krishna here and you are persistent in your thoughts about him.”716.
